ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I wish there was a course that combined the science of climate change (this one) with a law and policy/law course (Nic Robinson). In class, we frequently ended up discussing the ramifications of a particular finding - what kind of policy should be devised, etc. A team taught course next year? We do have one on sustainability.

Class design was very good for rapid learning in a range of anthropogenic environmental issues. Inventory project was well intended but could be made stronger by including inventory analysis issues throughout the course, instead of just at the end.

The fact that the lecture in a week was followed by student presentations. And other students had to do commentaries. That meant that I ended up reading the material every week, and participated in the class discussion (small class size - required this). So, I felt like I learnt a lot.
Professor's strong knowledge of the topics and ability to encourage discussion.

This course was established as a seminar format, and hearing from otehr students was a great part of the learning process. In addition, the instructor emphasized a wide array of topics and aspects of the course topic, and he had a deep understanding of those aspects.
Present us with a comprehensive picture of the biosphere in climate system. The structure of this class is clear and its topics are interesting
I liked the material. I liked the size of the class, which lent itself to a wonderful fluidity of discussion between lecture and student contribution.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I wish we had dwelled deeper into the science/state of scientific research on some of these topics.
Sharpening the objectives of the final project.

While the final assignment to critique an inventory method was useful (I'd been wanting an excuse to do this myself), the course did not lead into inventory projects at any point. I think what would have been more useful would have been a final exam rather than a project in order to reinforce some of the data and information that was presented during the semester.

While I enjoyed the final project, and don't necessarily think it should be replaced/modified, part of me wishes we'd had an exam. The course covered so much material, that an exam review and study process would have helped me consolidate the information and put it into memory more thoroughly. This could be more of a personal learning experience, than one that represents the way the rest of the class felt. And maybe there is another way, alternative to having exam, that could help close out the course through review, summary, and consolidation of key messages from each climate/pollutant phenomenon.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: None
Very responsive to questions, concerns. Great overall teaching style.
great.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am interested in environmental policy - particularly with reference to climate change. Therefore, understanding the science behind it, particularly the uncertainties and linkages involved was very useful.
This course provides me with greater training in analyzing environmental science challenges, particularly with regard to GHG sources and sinks, and air pollution.
My focus is forests and climate; this was my chance to gain a stronger grasp of the climate end of this spectrum.

Interactions of climate change and other industrial gases to and with the biosphere is critical to our understanding of the climate system overall. So, with that said, I am surprised that more students are enrolling in the class. On the other hand, I really appreciated that it was small seminar.
My academic background is Economics, and I'm studying climate change. This course gave many useful knowledge about climate change and relate it to many aspects.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See above
I knew the professor would be very good and I wanted to focus on a number of environmental issues in detail.
This was teh course I took to gain an understanding of the hard science components of climate change that I study from a forestry perspective.
It's helpful and interesting
I want to add some scientific background.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes

This course did help me get a perspective of the GHG agents, but I'd hoped I would come out of the course with a more rigorous understanding of various important facts and mechanisms I might need to be conversant in climate science and policy discussions.
Yes, absolutely
Yes.
Yes, much more than.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, more or less.
Yes, I had good discussion with classmates and presented topics to the class.
Yes
Yes.
I think my effort may not be enough to get the full advantage from the course.
